item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by The Bible for Today
item.description: "Therefore, do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own." -- The Bible for Today

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "For although nepenthe has calmed me, I know always that I am an outsider; a stranger in this century and among those who are still men. This I have known ever since I stretched out my fingers to the abomination within that great gilded frame; stretched out my fingers and touched a cold and unyielding surface of polished glass." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Kaitlin Hollon
item.description: "Always ask the questions you want to, life is too short to know if you'll get a second chance to ask , and afterlife is probably too long to wonder what the answer may be." -- Kaitlin Hollon

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "When I was a boy and I would see scary things in the news, my mother would say to me, "Look for the helpers. You will always find people who are helping." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "Solidarity was admirable; loyalty was the person standing next to you when the devil came to call." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Anderson
item.description: "I knew why earlier generations once believed that the sun circled the earth. Because, in our limited imaginations, that is how we lived our lives. -Mrs. Tuesday's Departure" -- Suzanne Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "Isn’t that the greatest tragedy? When someone rejects us, no matter how they abuse our love, we hope against reason that somehow they will come back to us." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "It’s describing the mystery of faith. I think it describes how difficult it is to believe in God’s presence even when we can’t see Him, even when we feel so alone and need His presence." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "The things that are priceless to my heart carry no currency where we are going." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "Was that part of faith, the willingness to step into the unknown and simply believe that God would be there with us? Would I be called on to do that for Mila? Or for Anna? Would I be able to take that step into thin air and believe that God will be with me no matter what?" -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "I know that when things are at their worst, something better is just around the corner if we just put one foot in front of the other and keep moving forward." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "And I know, when things look the worst is when something new and wonderful is about to happen, if we can just hold on." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "Some people gave up on their wishes and dreams because they’d been disappointed too many times in life and just didn’t have the courage to keep hoping things would change" -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "how many people never see how beautiful the sky is at night because they simply don’t take the time to look up?" -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne E. Anderson
item.description: "She silently thanked God for creating such a beautiful universe where anything was possible even when it seemed impossible." -- Suzanne E. Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "God used my year of waiting not to frustrate me, or abandon me, but to draw me into a closer relationship with Him." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "At times, it can feel like the loneliest place on Earth, because it’s just us. Alone with our unanswered prayers" -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "God’s joy can fill our days with gladness until we receive the answer we are waiting for." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "Knowing that God is the Provider of Limitless Blessing, I’d like to challenge you, in the midst of your own trials, to ask how you can bless someone else today." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "God may withhold an answer to prayer until we relinquish control of the outcome and put our complete trust in Him." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "By recalling God’s past provision, we can reassure ourselves that what He has done in the past, He will do again in the future." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "If we will turn to God in prayer, and if we will seek His comfort through His Words in the Bible, we will find our hearts and minds healed." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "By remembering how much we have to be grateful for we remind ourselves how beautifully God is already providing for our current needs." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "As I look back on my life, I understand now that there were some very important moments when my unanswered prayer was actually God’s greatest blessing" -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "I may never know when an answer to prayer is going to arrive, but I know that God will never fail me." -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson
item.description: "Do you have faith in your faith?" -- Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Paul Davies
item.description: "No attempt to explain the world, either scientifically or theologically, can be considered successful until it accounts for the paradoxical conjunction of the temporal and the atemporal, of being and becoming. And no subject conforms this paradoical conjuction more starkly than the origin of the universe." -- Paul Davies
